'Big Lincoln' why do you even play if you're just gonna insult riot about how horrible their champs are?

"Ekko is a street urchin stereotype who just happens to be smart enough to make a personal time machine."

Oh, golly gosh. It's almost as if he's, oh, I don't know, a product of his ecology or something! He hails from Piltover's underbelly equivalent, where both science and poverty are symbiotic. 

What else do you expect from an ambitious, rough-and-tumble teenager who can't stand to see his parents break their backs just for the bare necessities in life? He is the honor-bound son and the Renaissance man at the same time, looking to broaden his horizons in every direction while also trying his damnedest to stay grounded and remember where he came from. If you actually take a minute to savor the lore of each character, you might find a few that you like, Big Lincoln. However, I get the idea that you would be the person to watch a Shakespeare play with your headphones in and go "eh, writing was shit. I could have done it better."

Taliyah is a "control mage" who blows you up if you don't respect her zoning perfectly. Ekko is a skirmisher who blows you up if you let him jump on you and you don't kill him first. Camille is a diver who waits around for a good opportunity to enter a fight, does so, and proceeds to chunk out everyone in sight. And don't say she's basically Vi or Hecarim or Irelia, because she's not. Her kit is different and requires different execution. She plays with precision and sorta embodies what it means to be a _diver_ over just a facemelter or a high damage initiator or a pseudo-assassin.

Agreed on your points there, but she's less precision and more... brute force. My friend played the PBE and claims her extremely simple, and overpowered, as she embodies quick assassination while building tanky, very similar the the characters mentioned. You can go on about her E being all unique, but her two other abilities are just brute force kicks and attacks, and her ult is a bigger jarvan ult, less focused on the burst in a zone and rather trapping out a single unit (once again, Irelia, Vi, or Hecarim can do the same things less efficiently, with only 1 of them having true damage).

Her passive makes her scale in and provides a shield for problematic engages or encounters.  (Vi, Irelia (CC shielding)). 

Her Q is an easy triforce proc and provides true damage, which to be honest, is absolutely insane considering this is an bruiser/assassin/high damage initation, and there's a reason we don't provide assassins or initation with easy access to true damage besides specific abilities (usually with not even all that much) items or red buff. (Q being similar to Vi's E, Hecarim's Q, and Irelia's Q, W, E, with all of them being her primary resets for autos)

Her W is simple, with % max HP damage and sustain no less, also providing a large slow (Vi's W, Hecarim's W, and Irelia's W, with more or less just better effects if hit on the outer ring)

Her E is flat out ridiculous, providing extreme mobility and an long duration stun that is almost unnecessary considering she'll most likely aim for a bunch of targets grouped up since its an AOE stun. It also provides an extremely quick get away dash, and a secondary dash if needed, providing more than deemably strong mobility to an already ridiculous effect. And it provides attack speed. Yeah. (See Vi's Q+E combo, Irelia's Q+E+W combo, and hecarim's W+Q combo)

Her ult was described earlier, but just to summarize: You are stuck. Camille's team gets to hail mary the zone and if you're the one target, screw you, because you aren't safe. All it takes is one target, and you're done, not even the other bruisers can burst you down, and usually don't have a trap zone to help, meaning even if I ult as Vi or hecarim, Camille has the ability to call for her team to mark down her target, while the others have to hope during a teamfight that their engage is recognized and is assassinated fast enough before their CC wears off. (See Hecarim's Ult, and Vi's ult)

She just does what all these tanks do... but just... better. Its disgusting how much they actually overloaded her kit and made a lot of iconic abilities for these champions. you'd pick these champions that had equal strengths but varying weaknesses, meaning you had to choose a situation where one was good over the other, and just place Camille as a multi-tool capable of doing their jobs for them with just a better kit. And don't tell me "she's skill based" because no offense, but AoE stuns aren't hard to land. Especially with 2 dashes, one that passes through a wall, and then a jarvan ult that your team can just walk through towards the target.

Unless, of course, your name is Talon. In which case unless she has and lands her ult in time, she gets to run futilely around the first or second wall you hop while you go heal up for your next pass at her.

Talon's post-rework consistent mobility is the stuff of legends. As long as he doesn't stay in one place after having to hop, he's nigh untouchable. Talon One for Alls are amazing. The difference between most mobility champs' short, local bursts of mobility and Talon's ability to just flat out cross the entire map in seconds on whim on a fairly regular basis is huge.
